data.title: Great Tasting Biryani But
data.text: The place started out great as a fast food place for authentic Biryani. The food is still good but cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired.

data.title: Excellent Biryani
data.text: I love the Biryani and the Gobi Manchurian here. Not a big fan of their lunch buffets, used to like their lunch plates that they have sometimes.

data.title: Terrible
data.text: We were on our way to the movies and HUNGRY so we searched on Google maps for "restaurants near me".  Bad move!  What we found was Paradise Biryani.  It was dark inside, dismal, BUT two or three Indian couples and no one else were there.  Could this be "authentic" Indian food on the way to the movies, a place so Indian that they are clueless about presentation to the world but wonderful food, REAL Indian food.  NOT.  We ordered sag paneer and lamb tikka masala.  It was TERRIBLE.  I think they had a bag of sag paneer mix from the Indian grocery and threw it together.  The taste was to die FROM (not FOR).  The good part:  we did not get sick.

data.title: Great Biryani, Good Buffet Lunch too
data.text:
Living in Spain, I crave for good Indian food when in the US/UK. And this place totally lives up to the reputation this Biryani franchisee have.

Amazing Biryani, good buffet lunch too.

The biryani was so good that I didn't mind driving 30 miles just to have eat at Paradise Biryani Pointe, Sunrise.

That being said, just go there for the Biryani. Don't expect any fancy seating or service.

data.title: Beware
data.text: My Family decided to try this restaurant for the first time. The buffet price indicated $12.95 per adult. We went to pay and they actually charge $14.99. There is no sign indicating this new price. When I enquired, he said the price was raised because today was a holiday. However, Friday is not a holiday. Saturday is the 4th of July. They robbed me of money and refused to change it. Beware of this place. Additionally, it was so hot in the restaurant that it makes it an uncomfortable dinning experience. I'll never return.

data.title: Authentic Indian Food
data.text: You have to try this place. I have been looking for a dine-in restaurant in my area for a long time. Most Indian restaurants are very small so you have no choice but to do take out. Anyway, I went there one evening and as we were walking in, we saw people of the same origin that the food was from, going into the restaurant. Now, that is always a good sign! We found our seats in a well-lighted, open spaced environment and looked at the menu. There was a very wide selection. From drinks to appetizers to your main dishes and also desserts. I ordered the Mango Lassi which was a very delicious mango shake. The main dishes we ordered were the Chicken Tikki Masala which was so delicious that I did not want to move on to my other dish, which was the Goat Curry. Well, that was amazing too. One thing I forgot to ask was if there was going to be bones in it because there was. It was still tasty though. Along with your meats, you get Basmati Rice and you can also order different types of Nan. I got the Buttered Nan. They gave you so much food that it was enough for two dinners. You definitely get more for your money. The service was not bad either. It is not fine dining. So do not expect to them to be kissing you butt. However, if you want delicious indian cuisine, then that's a guarantee. Overall it was a very delightful and delectable surprise.

data.title: Quick Eat
data.text: Just showed up when it was already closing but they still accommodated with an amazing Biryani Shrimp...  The flavor was tasty and spicy

data.title: Curry anyone?
data.text:
My husband first took me here on Valentine's Day 2014. Upon arriving, I was turned off by the fact that it was just us until another family came in approximately 20 minutes later. If a restaurant is empty, I typically joke and say it is because OSHA made an inspection visit and it failed. 

That is not so in the case of this restaurant. It opened within the year and I do not think too many people are aware of it, along with the fact that there is another Indian restaurant within a 5 mile radius of this one that has been around for a much longer time.

It is a small restaurant but it affords you the feeling of cozy and intimate. The owner is onsite and is very personable.

The meals are reasonably priced and tastefully done. The wait staff, for the most part, are pleasant and helpful. I am not sure if they  are family members of the owner or not.

Yesterday, my best friend asked me where I wanted to go for my annual "birthday luncheon". I told her about this restaurant so we went. The previous two times that I went it had been empty at dinner time. Yesterday I was shocked that it was full. It was then brought to my attention that they do a Sunday buffet. It was absolutely divine.

data.title: Excellent biryani
data.text:
In my quench for a tasty vegetable biryani, I have to say this has been one of the best vegetable biryani so far.

I have visited this place both for a sit-in lunch, as well as for take-out, at least for about 5-6 times now.

The spice level is usually on the higher side, and occassionally the chef is able to customize the spice level to "very low" (since my kids cannot handle the high spice level), although many times, they have said the spice level cannot be adjusted as they prepare the biryani base ahead of time.
Many of my work colleagues have "cried" after eating here due to the spice levels. Keep a lot of yogurt nearby and you should be fine.

The portions are more than adequate - usually 1 veg biryani can satisfy 2 persons.

For Friday lunch buffet, the place is jam packed, thanks to folks from all the nearby companies coming in groups for lunch. The buffet has a large number of items including a few types of biryani, curries, curd vadas, sweets etc.

You will not be disappointed with this place.

data.title: Biryanis are tasty
data.text: I have been here couple of times. You will never miss Desi style Biryani in US. It is named under famous Hyderaba, Inida PARADISE Biryani Restaurant. Tyr Goat Meat Biryani, its very among other Biryani. Rates are around $14 for one. Apart from Biryanis you can order from their regular Menu.

data.title: Good food and prices
data.text: We ate here with relatives from Indianapolis and all of us agreed the food was excellent. I was looking for an Indian restaurant in the area and saw this on Tripadvisor. I had no idea it was even there and am glad we decided to give it a try. Will definitely return.

data.title: Tasty spicy food for decent price
data.text: We drove over 40 min to get good Biryani. We were not disappointed with the biryani. The staff were courteous and we did not have to wait long for the order to to be served. Price is good for the food and quantity was more than what we expected. The place is clean but average.

data.title: Great food
data.text: excellent Indian food! finally a good  Indian restaurant in Sunrise. The owners pay attention to all customers. I will definitely be back soon!

data.title: Excellent food, good ambiance, friendly service.
data.text: Its a great casual environment, good ambience, the owners are hands -on. Great tasting quality food without all the feeling of heaviness. Myself not an authority on the taste of authentic hyderabadi biryani, but talking with some of my friends from hyderabad that were with me vouched for the taste,presentation and quality. Being vegetarian its always hard to find good veg-biryani at the restaurants, but veg-biryani here was excellent. Tried palak paneer and malai kofta, they were excellent too. Garlic naan and cheese naan out of the world. Definately will be visiting again to try out the other dishes. Just opened on Friday 7-12-2013 so hopefully it will keep getting better as it matures unlike few other indian restaurants around. Will definately recommend it. Its a must visit.

data.title: Comdia Indiana gostasa e aqui!
data.text: Eu amo comida Indiana, tem cheirinho maravilhoso ! Quem gosta de comida arromatizada pode ir que vai gostar.

data.title: Maravilhoso!
data.text: Excelente refeição. Em um dia, almoçamos a la carte e, no outro, buffet. Comida excelente, bem temperada, atendimento nota 10, e a um preço bem acessível. Recomendo!

data.title: Muito bom
data.text: Comida boa. De sexta até domingo possui buffet livre por cerca de 10 dólares por pessoa. Nos demais dias da semana serve a la carte.

data.title: bom restaurante
data.text: um bom restaurante, oferece uma comida a um preço justo, ficava proximo ao hotel em que nos hospedamos.
